instructions.1: Heat 1-inch vegetable oil in a deep-sided skillet over medium heat.
instructions.2: Whisk buttermilk, lemon zest, paprika, and black pepper together in a wide bowl. Pour flour into a separate wide bowl. Place a paper towel-lined plate near the stovetop.
instructions.3: Dip 1/3 of asparagus into buttermilk mixture. Dredge in flour; coat thoroughly. Repeat with a second layer of buttermilk mixture and flour. Place coated asparagus, unstacked, onto a baking sheet. Repeat with remaining asparagus.
instructions.4: Fry coated asparagus, in three batches, in hot oil until golden brown, 2 to 4 minutes. Transfer to the paper towel-lined plate. Repeat frying until all the sticks are cooked. Serve immediately.

questions.question: In Step 3, is the buttermilk from Step 2 being used?
Is buttermilk from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is flour from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is paprika from Step 2 still available in Step 4?
Is black pepper live after Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 4?
If we skip Step 2, is it still valid to use the flour in Step 3?
Can we dip (Step 3) and fry (Step 4) at the same time?
